column1: #Text=Best Practices for Performance | SAP HANA Journey

#Text=Ottogi Elevates Data and Analytics with New Predictive Capabilities
#Text=SAP HANA Cloud, Adaptive Server Enterprise and Data Lake for Financial Services
#Text=What would you like to learn about?
#Text=SAP Analytics Cloud enables you to perform sophisticated analysis on large volumes of intricate data.
#Text=These complex scenarios can sometimes lead to less than ideal performance times for end-users.
#Text=However, there are things you can do when designing models and stories that will help SAP Analytics Cloud run at optimal performance levels.
#Text=In this post, we’ll share some best practices and tips to help keep things running smoothly.
#Text=Bonus: Advanced Formulas Best Practices documentation on Help Portal
#Text=Always use Google Chrome, our recommended browser, to take advantage of the latest performance improvements in SAP Analytics Cloud. * new
#Text=Take advantage of improved performance with browser cashing of story and boardroom.
#Text=This is particularly important for stories with multiple pages, charts or models.
#Text=Cache is valid as long as there are no structural changes made in the story or boardroom.
#Text=Note that this performance improvement is only available for Chrome users in a non-incognito mode. * new
#Text=In Model Preferences under Data and Performance, toggle on “Optimize Story Building Performance”.
#Text=This prevents the automatic refresh of data during story design.
#Text=Tip: When editing a story, designers can manually refresh data when desired using the data refresh prompt in the builder.
#Text=Whenever possible, choose to show unbooked data in a chart.
#Text=This means that the software has to spend less time differentiating between booked and unbooked data.
#Text=Avoid specifying Exception Aggregations in the Model (image below) and instead, use the Restricted Measures or Calculation functionality in your stories.
#Text=Try designing your story using Responsive pages instead of Canvas or Grid pages.
#Text=Responsive pages allow your story content to re-flow depending on the size of the screen it is being viewed on.
#Text=Tip: Responsive pages are the only page-type that can be viewed with the SAP Analytics Cloud Mobile App for iOS.
#Text=Rather than designing a large story with many pages, try to limit your pages and create different stories for each use-case or audience.
#Text=Tip: If you want to refer to a related story, you can add a hyperlink to a different page, story, or external website.
#Text=Try to keep the number of individual tiles on each page of your story limited to six or less
#Text=Limit the number of content-rich tiles on each page like maps or charts with a high volume of data points.
#Text=Overloading your pages with dense information will make it harder for your viewers to consume and may slow load-time.
#Text=Tip: Use pages to break up your story by category or type of information.
#Text=Put your most-viewed content on the first page to make it easily accessible.
#Text=When adding images to your pages ensure that the images are sized for web and are smaller than 1MB
#Text=Tip: SVG vectors image files still look great at a small file size.
#Text=If you can’t use an SVG image file, PNG image files perform better than JPG.
#Text=To ensure performance when working with blended data,  avoid creating Linked Dimensions on Calculated Dimensions.
#Text=Keeping the number of models linked in each story at a minimum will also improve overall speed and performance.
#Text=If your model contains a lot of dimensions, choose particular dimensions to show in the explorer rather than showing them all.
#Text=This cuts down on scrolling and makes it easier for you to find the dimensions you need.
#Text=Tip: When using the explorer to create a visualization, try de-selecting the “Automatically Synchronize Visualization” button.
#Text=By turning off this feature you can change your measure and dimension selections without auto-refreshing the visualization.
#Text=When you’re ready, simply click the “Synchronize Visualization” button to update your visualization.
#Text=Story designers can choose to enable the explorer on charts and tables while in view-mode.
#Text=When configuring this option, make sure to choose relevant measures and dimensions for your viewers to explore.
#Text=Lowering the number of individual data points makes the information in your stories easier to read and analyze.
#Text=When adding tables to your story, keep in mind the goal of the table and ensure that viewers can easily navigate the information.
#Text=To help ensure readability, try to limit your tables to a maximum of 500 rows and 60 columns.
#Text=If you need to display more, you can edit the drill limitation.
#Text=Keep in mind that the more cells you include, the harder SAP Analytics Cloud has to work to display them.
#Text=Tip: Apply chart filters to reduce the volume of information in charts with more than 1000+ data points and use table filters to keep a manageable amount of information visible in your tables.
#Text=For a Dimension with a large Hierarchy and an ALL node it is recommended to use the chart drill capability for best performance.
#Text=For Tables with Large datasets, it is recommended to avoid Formatting Rules
#Text=Location Clustering is automatically enabled when there are more than 5,000 points on a bubble layer.
#Text=To even further optimize your bubble layer, switch on Location Clustering and choose 1,000 for the maximum number of display points.
#Text=Tip: If you are working with thousands of locations consider using the choropleth layer instead.
#Text=This layer aggregates your data into shapes and you’re able to filter and drill-down on the shapes to get further insights into location data.
#Text=To create a location-enabled model from a live HANA data connection, you must first prepare a calculation view with location dimensions.
#Text=Location Data must be prepared through SAP HANA Studio.
#Text=After creating a model based on the calculation view in SAP Analytics Cloud, you can add one or more location dimensions to map the Location Data imported from the live HANA system.
#Text=For help, download instructions on Creating a Geo model from Live HANA Calculation View.
#Text=Use filtering relevant for your target audience to limit the number of facts in your story to one million or less.
#Text=The one million fact limit has been set purposefully to help you work with specific meaningful information rather than high-volumes.
#Text=If you’re creating a story with many elements based on the same information, try adding story filter capabilities instead of individual filters for pages, charts, or tables.
#Text=Note: The exception to this suggestion is for filtering on information from models with linked dimensions.
#Text=In these cases, it is best to add a filter to the individual tile when filtering on dimensions not used for linking.
#Text=Tip: Page filters that are displayed as tokens (eg.
#Text=Product below) take up less space in your story and are easier to work with than expanded page filters (eg.
#Text=When setting up your filter, try to select specific members rather than selecting “All Members”.
#Text=Filters with fewer members are easier to use during analysis and when viewing a story.
#Text=It is recommended to limit the number of Members in a Dimension used in Member Selectors and Filters to the minimum possible number of Members.
#Text=Tip: For members with large hierarchies, you can limit the number of levels available in the filter to make things easier to navigate.
#Text=It’s also helpful to design your story with the most used level displayed.
#Text=Tip: When drilling down, you can jump several levels at once to avoid loading levels that you are not interested in.
#Text=The Cascading Effect feature is enabled on pages with multiple filters by default.
#Text=When the feature is enabled, selections made on a story or page filter will affect related filters in the same story or page.
#Text=Toggling off the Cascading Effect feature reduces query volumes and can speed up filter performance.
#Text=When adding date and time range filters you’re able to choose between a dynamic or fixed range of time.
#Text=Check the SAP Analytics Cloud Help documentation for a detailed explanation of each option and tips on how to customize these filters.
#Text=For Tables with Large datasets, it is recommended to avoid Hidden Combinations and to use the Filter instead to only show the necessary Columns.
#Text=Tip: If you have a number of input controls on the page – leave them collapsed for improved performance!
#Text=Loading the list of values and cascading effects for collapsed story, page or topic filters will be delayed until the user selects the filter.
#Text=Therefore, greater priority is given to displaying data on the page found in charts, tables and expanded input controls.
#Text=When working with planning data, end users are mostly concerned with the numbers.
#Text=When designing stories with planning information, make sure to limit the number of descriptive columns in your tables.
#Text=This way users of your story will be able to access the information they need as quickly as possible.
#Text=Viewing your stories with the SAP Analytics Cloud Mobile App for iOS is extremely convenient.
#Text=However, a mobile device looks and acts a bit differently than your other screens.
#Text=There are a few ways that you can help ensure your stories are useful when viewed on mobile devices.
#Text=This is the only page-type that is accessible from the Mobile App for iOS.
#Text=Make sure you have some free space on your device.
#Text=The Mobile App performs best on iOS devices with 2GB or more of free space.
#Text=Limit the number of data points and values displayed on charts designed for mobile.
#Text=This helps to ensure that viewers of your story are able to navigate the information, no matter what size of screen they’re working with.
#Text=For even more information on the mobile app, check out the SAP Analytics Cloud Mobile App Learning Track.
#Text=Remove any unused pages in your story to help streamline your information and improve navigation for your users
#Text=When exiting your story, accept the prompt to remove models that are not in use.
#Text=You can always add new models when editing your story if you need to.
#Text=To avoid saving uncompleted work, SAP Analytics Cloud does not automatically save your stories.
#Text=So, remember to save changes that you’ve made when editing your stories before closing your browser.
#Text=Tip: To take advantage of performance improvements in each new release, you’ll have to open your stories in edit-mode and click save.
#Text=If you have an old story, take a few seconds to re-save it!
#Text=The latest performance improvements will be applied to help you enjoy your story content.
#Text=Re-Watch the Story Performance Tips & Tricks Webinar
#Text=We’ve been hard at work adding a number of features for speeding up your story performance.
#Text=In this webinar, we’ll review recent performance enhancements, learn specific changes you can make to improve performance and end with a Q&A.
#Text=Discover our data management and analytics offerings to expand on your data journey.
#Text=See how you can start making trusted business decisions with your data today.
